item.title: Report X-2025050310
item.description:
Report X-2025050310

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Forklift driver loading the freight punctured 2 boxes which spilled on trailer floor and yard. Brandon Hecker, 130/PHX operations supervisor, reported while a forklift operator was loading the freight, he punctured 2 cartons of UN3266. This resulted in a spill in the trailer and approx. 1 gallon of UN3266 leaking from the back of the trailer and onto the yard. Brandon advisedn no drains or waterways are impacted. Cura was contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025041905
item.description:
Report X-2025041905

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The package was wet and emitting a strong odor. Concealed DG. Rain X UN1230, Methanol. Hazard Class 3,(6), Packing Group II 1 (FedEx branded box) Multi paper wall box containing 3 RainX boxes bearing the LTD QTY marking. Each inner box contained 2 plastic bottles @3.785 Liters (8 Liters per box). 2 bottles leaked due to loose tops. All contents were placed in salvage drums and held for FAA investigation.
